summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs news briefing from April 19, 2021, covering a wide range of national security, law enforcement, and political news. It includes a brief mention that federal prosecutors confirmed a 2016 decision not to pursue Jeffrey Epstein, and a note that Ghislaine Maxwell's dismissal request was turned down, paving the way for trial. The bulk of the document covers other topics like the Indianapolis FedEx shooting, Capitol riot investigations, police shootings, and international relations.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a brief item stating federal prosecutors confirmed a 2016 decision not to pursue him.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in a brief item stating a judge turned down her dismissal request, meaning she must stand trial on sex-trafficking charges related to Epstein.

persons.name: Amanda Kramer
persons.context: Described as the SDNY prosecutor who met with Epstein accusers' lawyers in 2016 and later said she 'felt horrible' after learning of Epstein's abuse of the justice system in Florida.

connections.description: Maxwell is accused of recruiting girls for sex for her former boyfriend Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Meeting with SDNY on Epstein case
events.description: Lawyers for Epstein accusers met with then-Assistant U.S. Attorney Amanda Kramer in a conference room at SDNY headquarters, urging an investigation of Epstein.

events.title: DOJ decision not to pursue Epstein
events.description: Federal prosecutors in Manhattan confirmed they chose not to pursue Jeffrey Epstein in 2016.

events.title: Judge denies Maxwell's dismissal request
events.description: A U.S. judge rejected Ghislaine Maxwell's request to dismiss sex-trafficking charges, paving the way for a trial that could begin as soon as July 2021.

keyFacts: Federal prosecutors confirmed in a court filing that they chose not to pursue Jeffrey Epstein in 2016.
Former Assistant U.S. Attorney Amanda Kramer met with Epstein accusers' lawyers in February 2016 and later expressed regret after learning of Epstein's abuse of the justice system in Florida.
A judge denied Ghislaine Maxwell's dismissal request on April 16, 2021, meaning she must stand trial on charges of recruiting girls for sex for Epstein.
The document is primarily a broad news briefing; the Epstein/Maxwell references are two very brief items among hundreds covering unrelated current events.
The Maxwell item notes her trial was anticipated to begin as soon as July 2021.
